bugs.title: CVE-2024-35200 nginx: undisclosed HTTP/3 requests can cause NGINX worker processes to terminate [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-35200 nginx: undisclosed HTTP/3 requests can cause NGINX worker processes to terminate [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-35200 nginx: undisclosed HTTP/3 requests can cause NGINX worker processes to terminate

long_desc.thetext:
When NGINX Plus or NGINX OSS are configured to use the HTTP/3 QUIC module, undisclosed HTTP/3 requests can cause NGINX worker processes to terminate.

https://my.f5.com/manage/s/article/K000139612

Created nginx tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2283920]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2283925]


Created nginx:1.20/nginx tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2283921]


Created nginx:mainline/nginx tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2283923]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2283922]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2283919

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2283919,2283925

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

bugs.title: CVE-2024-34161 nginx: undisclosed QUIC packets can cause NGINX worker processes to leak previously freed memory [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-34161 nginx: undisclosed QUIC packets can cause NGINX worker processes to leak previously freed memory [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-34161 nginx: undisclosed QUIC packets can cause NGINX worker processes to leak previously freed memory

long_desc.thetext:
When NGINX Plus or NGINX OSS are configured to use the HTTP/3 QUIC module and the network infrastructure supports a Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) of 4096 or greater without fragmentation, undisclosed QUIC packets can cause NGINX worker processes to leak previously freed memory.

https://my.f5.com/manage/s/article/K000139627

Created nginx tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2283927]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2283932]


Created nginx:1.20/nginx tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2283928]


Created nginx:mainline/nginx tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2283930]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2283929]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2283926

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-32760 nginx: undisclosed HTTP/3 encoder instructions terminate or cause or other potential impact [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-32760 nginx: undisclosed HTTP/3 encoder instructions terminate or cause or other potential impact [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-32760 nginx: undisclosed HTTP/3 encoder instructions terminate or cause or other potential impact

When NGINX Plus or NGINX OSS are configured to use the HTTP/3 QUIC module, undisclosed HTTP/3 encoder instructions can cause NGINX worker processes to terminate or cause or other potential impact.

bugs.title: CVE-2024-31079 nginx: undisclosed HTTP/3 requests can cause NGINX worker processes to terminate [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-31079 nginx: undisclosed HTTP/3 requests can cause NGINX worker processes to terminate [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-31079 nginx: undisclosed HTTP/3 requests can cause NGINX worker processes to terminate

long_desc.thetext:
When NGINX Plus or NGINX OSS are configured to use the HTTP/3 QUIC module, undisclosed HTTP/3 requests can cause NGINX worker processes to terminate or cause other potential impact. This attack requires that a request be specifically timed during the connection draining process, which the attacker has no visibility and limited influence over.

https://my.f5.com/manage/s/article/K000139611

Created nginx tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2283943]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2283946]


Created nginx:1.20/nginx tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2283942]


Created nginx:mainline/nginx tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2283944]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2283941]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2283940

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by heffer.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'ignored'.
This update has been pushed to testing.

notes:
*) Security: when using HTTP/3, processing of a specially crafted QUIC
       session might cause a worker process crash, worker process memory
       disclosure on systems with MTU larger than 4096 bytes, or might have
       potential other impact (CVE-2024-32760, CVE-2024-31079,
       CVE-2024-35200, CVE-2024-34161).
       Thanks to Nils Bars of CISPA.

    *) Bugfix: reduced memory consumption for long-lived requests if "gzip",
       "gunzip", "ssi", "sub_filter", or "grpc_pass" directives are used.

    *) Bugfix: nginx could not be built by gcc 14 if the --with-atomic
       option was used.
       Thanks to Edgar Bonet.

    *) Bugfix: in HTTP/3.
title: nginx-1.26.1-1.fc40
